ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Understanding marketing issues and techniques in developing markets.Yes.

Yes I absolutely would, especially (but not limited to) students interested in international development and program evaluation. As a development student this was one of the most useful courses I've taken at Yale.
Very worthwhile for anyone interested in development and development economics. Provides a solid foundation in a multitude of field research and analytic techniques.
I would recommend the course for any student interested in pursuing work in development.
Very interesting for those interested in Development work, not at all economics heavy

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course exposed me to a tremendous amount of relevant theory and empirical research related to development.
Helped to point me in the direction of considering the field of microfinance/poverty alleviation as a potential career option.
Fantastic course, super interesting. Some kinks need to be worked out but a terrific topic for a course and I hope it's taught in the future!
This course provided the logical framework to apply to questions of development, an invaluable tool moving forward.
